title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0044

segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erika.
And we're bringing you another great elementary lesson for all our elementary learners.
segments.cn: 我们为所有初学者带来另一堂精彩的初级课程。

segments.en: You know what, Marco?
I think this lesson is so useful.
segments.cn: 我觉得这节课非常有用。

segments.en: This is language that you can actually use every single day.
segments.cn: 这是你每天都可以使用的语言。

segments.en: Exactly.
Every day.
Exactly.
Because today we're going to be teaching you small talk.
segments.cn: 因为今天我们要教你闲聊。

segments.en: So, what is small talk?
Well, small talk is small conversations that you would have with people that you don't know very well, but you still want to be polite.
segments.cn: 嗯，闲聊是你与不太熟悉的人进行的小对话，但你仍然想保持礼貌。

segments.en: Yes.
Right?
And you want to maybe just chat a little bit.
Okay, so let's listen to our dialogue.
segments.cn: 好的，让我们听听我们的对话。

segments.en: And as always, it's going to be a little bit fast, but don't worry about it.
segments.cn: 和往常一样，会有点快，但别担心。

segments.en: Because we'll come back in a minute and help you with some of the difficult language.
segments.cn: 因为我们会在一分钟后回来，帮助你理解一些难懂的语言。

segments.en: Morning.
Hi there, Mr. Anderson.
How are you on this fine morning?
Fine.
Thank you.
It sure is cold this morning, isn't it?
I barely even got out of bed.
Yeah, it's pretty cold, alright.
Did you catch the news this morning?
segments.cn: 你今天早上看到新闻了吗？

segments.en: I heard that there was a fire in Byron Street.
segments.cn: 我听说在Byron街发生了火灾。

segments.en: No, I didn't hear about that.
Did you happen to watch the football game last night?
segments.cn: 你昨晚看足球比赛了吗？

segments.en: The Patriots scored in the last minute.
segments.cn: 爱国者队在最后一分钟得分。

segments.en: No, I don't like football.
Oh, by the way, I saw you with your daughter at the office Christmas party.
segments.cn: 哦，顺便说一下，我在办公室圣诞派对上看到你和你的女儿。

segments.en: She's really beautiful.
She's my wife.
Oh, here's my floor.
Nice talking to you.
Goodbye!
Oh, sir, this is the 56th floor.
We're on the 70th.
That's okay, I'll take the stairs.
Okay, I think this guy was a little bit annoying.
segments.cn: 好吧，我觉得这个人有点烦人。

segments.en: Yeah, Mr. Anderson really didn't want to talk to him, did he?
segments.cn: 是的，Anderson先生真的不想和他说话，是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, I think that was pretty obvious.
He left the elevator in a hurry.
Okay, let's take a look at our language today in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看今天的语言要点。

segments.en: Language Takeaway.
Alright, what do we have today in Language Takeaway?
segments.cn: 好吧，今天的语言要点是什么？

segments.en: Well, we've got four words and phrases and our first one is barely even.
segments.cn: 我们有四个单词和短语，第一个是barely even。

segments.en: Barely even.
Barely even.
So how do we use barely even?
segments.cn: 那么我们如何使用barely even？

segments.en: It's a little bit difficult.
It's really similar to like almost couldn't or almost nothing or almost can't.
segments.cn: 它与几乎不能、几乎没有或几乎不能做非常相似。

segments.en: So we use it usually in a negative sense.
segments.cn: 所以我们通常在否定的意义上使用它。

segments.en: For example, I could say I was so busy today I could barely even eat my lunch.
segments.cn: 例如，我可以说我今天忙得连午餐都几乎没吃。

segments.en: Okay, so I can maybe say it was so dark I could barely even see.
segments.cn: 好吧，我可以说天黑得我几乎看不见。

segments.en: Yeah, or I'm so poor I can barely even pay my rent.
segments.cn: 是的，或者我太穷了，几乎连房租都付不起。

segments.en: Okay, good.
Barely even.
Alright, let's take a look at our next one.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看下一个。

segments.en: Catch.
Catch.
Catch.
Did you catch the news?
So by did you catch the news you mean did you hear the news?
segments.cn: 所以你问“你看到新闻了吗？”是指“你听到新闻了吗？”

segments.en: Exactly.
So how else can we use this?
segments.cn: 那我们还可以怎么用这个？

segments.en: Did you catch?
A really common one is I didn't catch your name.
segments.cn: 一个很常见的用法是我没听到你的名字。

segments.en: Yeah, I didn't hear your name.
segments.cn: 是的，我没听到你的名字。

segments.en: I would say I didn't catch what he said.
segments.cn: 我会说我没听到他说的话。

segments.en: I didn't catch what he said, yeah.
segments.cn: 我没听到他说的话，是的。

segments.en: So I didn't hear.
Yeah.
Okay, let's look at our next word.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看下一个单词。

segments.en: By the way.
By the way.
By the way.
By the way.
Okay, so let's listen to some examples first of how we can use by the way and then we'll come back and talk more about it.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们先听一些例子，看看如何使用“顺便说一下”，然后我们再回来讨论更多。

segments.en: Example one.
Are you going to be at the meeting today?
Yeah, I'll be there.
Oh, by the way, did you hear what happened today?
segments.cn: 哦，顺便说一下，你听说今天发生了什么吗？

segments.en: Example two.
By the way, I almost forgot to tell you, Maggie called.
segments.cn: 顺便说一下，我差点忘了告诉你，Maggie打电话来了。

segments.en: Okay, so I see that when we say by the way, we're introducing a point after we've already talked about something.
segments.cn: 好吧，我看到当我们说“顺便说一下”时，我们是在引入一个点，在我们已经谈论过某事之后。

segments.en: Exactly, and maybe it's not even related to the topic we were talking about.
segments.cn: 确切地说，可能与我们正在谈论的话题无关。

segments.en: No, it's a different topic.
Different topic, right?
It's like saying, oh, I almost forgot to tell you.
segments.cn: 就像说，哦，我差点忘了告诉你。

segments.en: Exactly.
So it's like, oh, Erika, don't forget we have a meeting today.
segments.cn: 所以就像，哦，Erika，别忘了我们今天有会议。

segments.en: Oh, and by the way, I like your new haircut.
segments.cn: 哦，顺便说一下，我喜欢你的新发型。

segments.en: Thanks, Marco.
All right, see?
That's the way you would use by the way.
segments.cn: 这就是你使用“顺便说一下”的方式。

segments.en: Okay, and our last word on language takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，我们最后一个语言要点。

segments.en: Take the stairs.
Take the stairs.
Take the stairs.
Take the stairs.
So it doesn't mean you're gonna take them somewhere.
segments.cn: 所以这并不意味着你要把它们带到某个地方。

segments.en: No, no, you're not taking them home with you.
segments.cn: 不，不，你不是把它们带回家。

segments.en: It means you're gonna go up the stairs.
Mm-hmm.
Okay, so take the stairs.
Yes, a lot of people might say use the stairs or go up the stairs, but our EnglishPod learners, they know, right?
segments.cn: 是的，很多人可能会说用楼梯或上楼梯，但我们的EnglishPod学习者，他们知道，对吧？

segments.en: To use, take the stairs.
Yep.
Take the stairs.
Okay, so now we're ready to listen to our dialogue again.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们准备再次听我们的对话。

segments.en: We're gonna slow it down a little bit.
And this will help you to catch these phrases a little bit better.
segments.cn: 这将帮助你更好地捕捉这些短语。

segments.en: Morning.
Hi there, Mr. Anderson.
How are you on this fine morning?
Fine, thank you.
It sure is cold this morning, isn't it?
I barely even got out of bed.
Yeah, it's pretty cold, alright.
Did you catch the news this morning?
I heard that there was a fire in Byron Street.
segments.cn: 我听说在Byron街发生了火灾。

segments.en: No, I didn't hear about that.
Did you happen to watch the football game last night?
segments.cn: 你昨晚有看足球比赛吗？

segments.en: The Patriots scored in the last minute.
segments.cn: 爱国者队在最后一分钟得分。

segments.en: No, I don't like football.
Oh, by the way, I saw you with your daughter at the Opus Christmas party.
segments.cn: 哦，顺便说一下，我在Opus圣诞派对上看到你和你的女儿。

segments.en: She's really beautiful.
She's my wife.
Oh, here's my floor.
Nice talking to you.
Goodbye.
Oh, sir, this is the 56th floor.
We're on the 70th.
That's okay, I'll take the stairs.
Okay, so now let's take a look at ways to start up some small talk in putting it together.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们看看如何开始一些小谈话。

segments.en: Putting it together.
So, Marco, today we've got some great patterns or structures that you can use in in your small talk.
segments.cn: 所以，Marco，今天我们有一些很好的模式或结构可以在小谈话中使用。

segments.en: Yeah, exactly.
We saw some great patterns.
segments.cn: 我们看到了一些很好的模式。

segments.en: Let's start with the first one.
It sure is cold this morning.
It sure is cold.
It sure is cold.
It sure is cold.
Okay, so we can change it up a little bit and say it sure is hot.
segments.cn: 好的，我们可以稍微改变一下，说确实很热。

segments.en: Mm-hmm.
Or it sure is late.
Okay, this sure is interesting.
Mm-hmm.
Or you could say he sure is smart.
segments.cn: 或者你可以说他确实很聪明。

segments.en: So basically you can change the adjective.
segments.cn: 所以基本上你可以改变形容词。

segments.en: Yes.
Cold, hot, smart, hard, difficult.
And when you say sure is, this is a great way of emphasizing that you believe this adjective to be true.
segments.cn: 当你说“确实是”时，这是强调你认为这个形容词是正确的好方法。

segments.en: Okay, sure is.
Now what would be the answer to this?
segments.cn: 那么这个的回答是什么？

segments.en: Well, in the dialogue, Mr. Anderson said, yeah, it's pretty cold, all right.
segments.cn: 好吧，在对话中，Anderson先生说，是的，确实很冷。

segments.en: It's pretty cold, all right.
It's pretty cold, all right.
So again, using the examples we used before, we can say, oh, it's pretty hot, all right.
segments.cn: 所以再次使用我们之前的例子，我们可以说，哦，确实很热。

segments.en: Mm-hmm.
Or it's pretty late, all right.
Or he's pretty smart, all right.
Mm-hmm.
Or this is pretty interesting, all right.
So it means you're agreeing with that person.
segments.cn: 所以这意味着你在同意那个人。

segments.en: Exactly.
Okay, great.
So, Marco, these things, it sure is blank.
segments.cn: 所以，Marco，这些东西，确实是空白。

segments.en: And yeah, it's blank, all right.
These can go together really well, can't they?
segments.cn: 这些可以很好地结合在一起，是吗？

segments.en: Yeah, as a question-and-answer format.
Mm-hmm.
They go well.
So why don't we listen to some examples of how these two phrases work together.
segments.cn: 那么我们为什么不听一些这些短语如何结合在一起的例子呢。

segments.en: Example one.
It sure is a nice day today.
Yeah, it's nice, all right.
Example two.
The bus is sure late today.
Yeah, it's late, all right.
Example three.
This class is really hard.
Yeah, it's hard, all right.
Okay, so now let's take a look at our next word and putting it together.
segments.cn: 好的，现在让我们看看下一个词并整合起来。

segments.en: Did you happen to... Did you happen to... Did you happen to... Did you happen to... Did you happen to see Bob this morning?
segments.cn: 你碰巧... 你碰巧... 你碰巧... 你碰巧... 你碰巧今早看到Bob吗？

segments.en: I didn't happen to see Bob.
So it means like... Like, did you by chance?
segments.cn: 所以这意味着像... 像，你碰巧吗？

segments.en: By chance.
Did you by chance see Bob or something?
segments.cn: 你碰巧看到Bob或其他什么吗？

segments.en: Yeah.
Okay, another example would be, did you happen to go to that restaurant I recommended?
segments.cn: 好的，另一个例子是，你碰巧去过我推荐的那家餐厅吗？

segments.en: Mmm.
Or maybe, do you happen to have a pen?
segments.cn: 或者，也许你碰巧有一支笔吗？

segments.en: Do you happen to know where the bathroom is?
segments.cn: 你碰巧知道洗手间在哪里吗？

segments.en: Yeah, that's a really useful one.
That's a useful one.
That's basically how you would use this structure.
segments.cn: 这基本上就是你使用这个结构的方式。

segments.en: Did you happen to... Do you happen to... So now let's listen to our dialogue for the third time, and I'm sure that you'll be able to understand everything.
segments.cn: 你碰巧... 你碰巧... 所以现在让我们第三次听我们的对话，我相信你能理解一切。

segments.en: Morning.
Hi there, Mr. Anderson.
How are you on this fine morning?
Fine, thank you.
It sure is cold this morning, isn't it?
segments.cn: 今天早上确实很冷，是吧？

segments.en: I barely even got out of bed.
Yeah, it's pretty cold, all right.
Did you catch the news this morning?
segments.cn: 你今天早上看到新闻了吗？

segments.en: I heard that there was a fire in Byron Street.
segments.cn: 我听说拜伦街发生了火灾。

segments.en: No, I didn't hear about that.
Did you happen to watch the football game last night?
segments.cn: 你碰巧昨晚看了足球比赛吗？

segments.en: The Patriots scored in the last minute.
segments.cn: 爱国者队在最后一分钟得分。

segments.en: No, I don't like football.
Oh, oh, by the way, I saw you with your daughter at the office Christmas party.
segments.cn: 哦，顺便说一下，我在办公室圣诞派对上看到你和你的女儿。

segments.en: She's really beautiful.
She's my wife.
Oh, here's my floor.
Nice talking to you.
Goodbye.
Oh, sir, this is the 56th floor.
Where on the 70th?
That's okay, I'll take the stairs.
All right, Marco, that was a really useful dialogue for daily life, wasn't it?
segments.cn: 好吧，马尔科，这真是一个对日常生活很有用的对话，是吧？

segments.en: Yeah, I think you can find a lot of useful language there, and that you can apply tomorrow.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得你可以在这里找到很多有用的语言，明天就可以用上。

segments.en: Yeah, well, speaking of useful things, let's talk a little bit about our website.
segments.cn: 是的，嗯，谈到有用的事情，我们来聊聊我们的网站。

segments.en: Yeah, be sure to go to our website at EnglishPod.com, where you can find other lessons as well.
segments.cn: 是的，确保访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com，那里你还可以找到其他课程。

segments.en: Maybe you're an intermediate student or advanced.
segments.cn: 也许你是中级学生或高级学生。

segments.en: Yes, so we've got intermediate, advanced, upper intermediate lessons on our website.
segments.cn: 是的，所以我们的网站上有中级、高级和上中级的课程。

segments.en: And a lot of other resources that you can explore.
segments.cn: 还有很多其他资源可以探索。

segments.en: So be sure to come to our website and leave all your comments, because Erica and I are always there, and we're really happy to answer all of your questions.
segments.cn: 所以一定要来我们的网站，留下你的评论，因为埃里卡和我总是在那里，我们很乐意回答你的所有问题。

segments.en: Okay, everyone, well, we're out of time, but until next time, goodbye.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，我们时间到了，但下次再见，再见。

segments.en: you.
